arm_group.description: 30 minutes group session with animal-assisted activity twice a week for 12 weeks in groups of 4-6 participants.
30 minutes group session with animal-assisted therapy twice a week for 12 weeks in groups of 4-6 participants
Control group with treatment as usual

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall research aim of this study is to investigate changes in measures related to the
      risk of falls among elderly with dementia participating in animal-assisted interventions.
      Also relatives' experience of own and the elderly's situation during and after the
      intervention will be examined.  The design will be a prospective and cluster randomized
      multicenter trial, but mixed-methods will be used to target different outcomes. The study
      population will be elderly (age above 65) at day care centers diagnosed with dementia, or
      having a cognitive deficit. The intervention will consist of 30 minutes sessions with
      animal-assisted activity or animal-assisted therapy two times a week for 12 weeks in groups
      of 4-6 participants. Control groups will receive treatment as usual. Research questions:

        1. Is there an effect in use of ordinary and optional medication among elderly persons
           with dementia at day care centers participating in animal-assisted interventions
           compared to a control group?

        2. Is there an effect on social interaction, quality of life, activeness and wellbeing
           among elderly persons with dementia at day care centers participating in
           animal-assisted interventions compared to a control group?

        3. Is there an effect on balance among elderly persons with dementia at day care centers
           participating in animal-assisted therapy compared to animal-assisted activity or a
           control group?

        4. Do relatives of elderly persons with dementia at day care centers experience a change
           in their own and the elderly's situation after the intervention compared with before
           the intervention started?

clinical_study.brief_title: Animal-assisted Interventions in Health Promotion for Elderly With Dementia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of dementia or having a cognitive deficit measured as a score less than 25
             on Mini-Mental State Examination.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Fear of dogs, dog allergy or need of wheel chair

clinical_study.official_title: Animal-assisted Interventions in Health Promotion for Elderly With Dementia; Impact on Factors Related to Risk of Falls

other_outcome.description: A device worn by the participants for one week at each time point of measure, night and day, measuring physical movement. Will be used to calculate physical activity during day time and sleep efficacy during the night.
other_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity measured by Actigraphy
other_outcome.time_frame: Second last or last week before the intervention starts, after 6 weeks of the intervention, and first or second week after end of intervention

other_outcome.description: The video recordings will be analyzed with respect to social interaction and group dynamics
other_outcome.measure: Video recordings of two group session at each location
other_outcome.time_frame: After two and ten weeks of the intervention

other_outcome.measure: Change in optional and ordinary medication
other_outcome.time_frame: Second last or last week before the intervention starts, first or second week after the end of intervention. A follow-up measure 3 months after end of the intervention

oversight_info.authority: Norway:The Regional Comittees for Medical and Health Research Ethics in Norway

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Norwegian version of Berg balance test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Second last or last week before the intervention starts, after 4 and 8 weeks of the intervention, and first or second week after end of intervention. A follow-up measure 3 months after end of the intervention

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Norwegian version of Quality of Life in Late-Stage Dementia (QUALID)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Second last or last week before the intervention starts, after 6 weeks of the intervention, and first or second week after end of intervention. A follow-up measure 3 months after end of the intervention

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
